Facial Recognition¶

Camera Functions¶

camera.py is used to connect pi to the camera and getting image frame from the camera for further analysis

class model.camera.Camera[source]¶

All functions in this file are stored within this class

static draw_bounding_box(barcode)[source]¶

This draws a bounding box around any detected barcodes.

static grab_frame()[source]¶

grab the frame from the threaded video stream and resize it to have a maximum width of 400 pixels

static scan_code()[source]¶

This grabs a single frame from the camera and looks for QR codes. If it finds one, it decodes it and returns it.

static scan_face()[source]¶

This scans a frame for any faces, and if one is found, returns it.

static start_camera()[source]¶

Initialize the camera.

static stop_camera()[source]¶

Stops the camera when called.

static stop_camera_key_stroke()[source]¶

Stops the camera capture with any user input keystroke.

Face Scanner¶

facialScanner.py is called when there is a facial login request. This recognize the face of the customer and pass the username as one of the two part process of the authentication

class model.facialScanner.FacialScanner[source]¶

All functions in this file are stored within this class.

static start_scanning()[source]¶

Use the camera to continually scan for faces. Return the name of any user recognized.
